abstract: With fewer people working and those employed working fewer hours, it's not surprising at all that the nation's total hours worked dropped significantly, an economist writes.
snippet: With fewer people working and those employed working fewer hours, it's not surprising at all that the nation's total hours worked dropped significantly, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

headline.main: Are Employers Requiring People to Work Longer Hours?
